thread.title_full: Downtown Italian restaurant gains a following - Sun Sentinel

author: Marci Shatzman
title: Downtown Italian restaurant gains a following
text:
Open for dinner six nights a week and about to open for lunch, Roots Italian Kitchen is garnering glowing reviews and comments like "what a find" on social media.
Walk in the front door at 212 S. Federal Highway and find open-air dining out back. Diners can sit almost privately in a courtyard, sheltered by other venues in Royal Palm Place.
That's executive chef and owner Michael Latimore peeking out of the open kitchen in the informal dining room. But don't let the casual d√©cor fool you. This is an upscale Italian food emporium.
"It has to be authentic and you have to taste the freshness," he said.
"Always homemade" is the restaurant's motto.
"We make our own mozzarella," said operations director and co-owner Yuriy Kouzenkov. That's evident in the four mozzarella appetizer choices. Among them is a trio of truffled, fresh burrata made from mozzarella and cream, mozzarella nodino with a denser texture and Prosciutto di Parma, the thinly sliced dry cured ham.

Prices are $14 to $16 with the trio for $25.
Among the other appetizers are grilled octopus, stuffed eggplant, fried calamari and homemade gnocchi. Prices range from $12 [for salad] to $18.
Pasta, risotto and gnocchi dishes may be dressed up with chicken or shrimp if they aren't already. Sauces range from the traditional Alfredo, fresh tomato to Bolognese meat sauce. Prices range from $18 to $28 with shrimp fra diavolo for $35. Our waiter recommended dusting the gnocchi with Parmesan cheese.
Main course choices are Florida snapper, salmon, chicken and octopus dishes that range from $24 to $36. A wine maven, Kouzenkov has a whole wall of vino and recommended a Valpollicella Ripasso or Baby Amorone. He even has Barolo. Wine is by the glass or bottle.
Roots also offers a three-course sunset special menu for $29 from 5 to 6 p.m. every day they're open, Tuesday through Sunday. Latimore's homemade tiramisu is one of the desserts.
Roots Italian Kitchen, 212 S. Federal Highway, Boca Raton, hours 5 to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, 5 to 10 p.m. Friday and Saturday and 5 to 9 p.m. Sunday. For reservations vist rootsitaliankitchen.com/ or call 561-757-6581.
